result.execSummary:
The defendant Latoya J. Wolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Includes 10% surcharge
PO to determine reasonable and practical monthly amount towards restitution; pay a reasonable portion of any earnings during incarceration towards restitution
Obtain/maintain employment or education or provide proof of Social Security Disability Income

No consumption of alcohol and/or illegal substances
No controlled substances unless prescribed and then only in the manner/dosage as prescribed

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Take all medications as prescribed by treating physician in the manner and dosage prescribed
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Cooperate with and complete an AODA assessment and any treatment deemed necessary
Cooperate with and complete a psychiatric assessment and any treatment deemed necessary

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latoya J. Wolf

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: allowing access to PSI-includes cover letter

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
10:07 a.m. Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have received and reviewed PSI. Schiek has presented Victim Impact Statements. Defense takes no issue to any facts in PSI. Schiek statement on sentencing. Gramstrup statement on sentencing. Gramstrup states 295 days sentence credit - Schiek stipulates. Defendant statement. Court statement to sentencing. 

Court Sentence
Prison - 25 years
  Initial confinement  - 12 years
  Extended supervision - 13 years
Sentence Credit - 295
Restitution - $11,000 (includes 10%)
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample 
PO to determine reasonable and practical monthly amount towards restitution; pay a reasonable portion of any earnings during incarceration towards restitution
Take all medications as prescribed by treating physician in the manner and dosage prescribed
Cooperate with and complete an AODA assessment and any treatment deemed necessary
Cooperate with and complete a psychiatric assessment and any treatment deemed necessary
No consumption of alcohol and/or illegal substances
No controlled substances unless prescribed and then only in the manner/dosage as prescribed
Obtain/maintain employment or education or provide proof of Social Security Disability income
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO 

Appeal rights given. 
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment given.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence given.

Adj. 11:00 a.m.

1:35 p.m Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to  2nd degree homicide (PTAC) contrary to 940.05(1) a Class B Felony - Granted.  Schiek states sentence recommendation will be 12 years initial confinement, 13 years extended supervision. Defendant pleads no contest. Plea questionaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court orders PSI. Bail revoked.  Adj. 1:49 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

01:31 pm - Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states has been in contact with Gramstrup, believes an agreement is possible - requests a plea hearing date and will most likely request a PSI at that time.  Bail continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

10:33 a.m. Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court, in custody; her attorney Chris A. Gramstrup appears by phone. Michael Schiek, D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement - discussions ongoing/joint request for adjournment. Gramstrup agrees to adj. Court approves joint request for adj. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

09:58 am - Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states has been in discussions - substantial amount of discovery to get through - Gramstrup is still going through discovery and request a continuance.  Gramstup states is through 80 to 90% of the discovery, request another date six to eight weeks out.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
from DA Schiek regarding defendant's furlough request
Reporter's Transcript of the Recorded Interview of Latoya Wolf on January 23, 2015
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court in custody with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gramstrup states defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.   State files information sheet.  Waives formal reading and enters plea of Not Guilty.  Atty Schiek statement regarding Discovery.  Court sets over for pretrial.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

01:39 pm - Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court, via video, with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

01:51 pm - Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states PD's office has not been able to appoint an attorney as of today's date.  Defendant is eligible for PD representation.  Court adjourns.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
no contact of any kind w/Shannon Wolf

01:39 pm - Defendant Latoya J. Wolf in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be faxed to jail, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Confirmed with Mary- Latoya already in custody by the time warrant was received by them.
